title: Did the Huns inspire the Mongols in any way? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Mongols certainly looked back to the Xiongnu, who are sometimes identified with the peoples whom the West knew as Huns. Huns may have been more of a mix of people. The graves of the Xiongnu leaders had all been looted. So Mongols kept their burials secret. No one has yet discovered the grave of Genghis Khan. But the pattern of nomad conquest was older than Xiongnu.
